Good.q: How can I maintain good indoor air quality?
Good.a: Keep windows open for ventilation, use air purifiers if available, avoid indoor smoking, and regularly clean dust from surfaces.

Good.q: Is it safe to exercise outdoors today?
Good.a: Yes, air quality is good. Outdoor exercise is safe for all age groups.

Good.q: What are the benefits of fresh air?
Good.a: Fresh air improves lung function, boosts mood, and supports overall health by reducing exposure to indoor pollutants.
Yes, opening windows helps ventilate your home and maintain good air quality when outdoor air is clean.

Good.q: How can I help keep the air clean?
Good.a: Limit vehicle use, avoid burning waste, and support green spaces to help maintain clean air in your community.

Moderate.a: People with respiratory or heart conditions, children, and the elderly should limit prolonged outdoor exertion.

Moderate.q: Is it okay to go for a walk?
Moderate.a: Yes, but consider shorter walks and avoid high-traffic areas if you are sensitive to air pollution.

Moderate.q: How can I reduce indoor pollution?
Moderate.a: Use exhaust fans, avoid burning candles or incense, and keep your home clean to reduce indoor pollutants.

Moderate.q: What are common sources of moderate pollution?
Moderate.a: Vehicle emissions, construction dust, and industrial activity are common sources.

Moderate.q: Should I monitor air quality updates?
Moderate.a: Yes, stay informed about changing air quality, especially if you belong to a sensitive group.

Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups.q: Who is considered sensitive to air pollution?
Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups.a: Children, elderly, pregnant women, and people with heart or lung conditions are most sensitive.
If air quality is poor, children should limit outdoor activities and may wear masks if necessary.

Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups.q: Is it safe for elderly to go outside?
Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups.a: Elderly people should avoid strenuous outdoor activities and stay indoors as much as possible.
Limit outdoor exercise, sports, and any activity that increases breathing rate.

Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups.q: How can I protect my pets?
Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups.a: Keep pets indoors during poor air quality and ensure they have clean water and food.

Unhealthy.q: What type of mask should I wear outdoors?
Unhealthy.a: Wear a certified N95 or equivalent mask to filter out fine particles when outdoors.

Unhealthy.q: How long is it safe to exercise outside?
Unhealthy.a: Limit outdoor exercise to short durations and avoid peak pollution hours (morning and evening).
Yes, keep windows and doors closed to prevent outdoor air from entering your home.

Unhealthy.q: What indoor air purification methods work best?
Unhealthy.a: Use HEPA air purifiers, keep your home clean, and avoid indoor smoking or burning candles.

Unhealthy.q: Are certain times of day safer for outdoor activities?
Unhealthy.a: Midday is often safer, but always check real-time air quality updates before going outside.

Very Unhealthy.q: Should I avoid all outdoor activities?
Very Unhealthy.a: Yes, stay indoors as much as possible and avoid all outdoor physical activities.

Very Unhealthy.q: How can I create a clean room at home?
Very Unhealthy.a: Seal windows and doors, use an air purifier, and avoid using gas stoves or burning candles indoors.

Very Unhealthy.q: What are the symptoms of air pollution exposure?
Very Unhealthy.a: Symptoms include coughing, shortness of breath, eye irritation, and fatigue. Seek medical help if severe.

Very Unhealthy.q: How can I help children stay safe indoors?
Very Unhealthy.a: Keep children indoors, provide activities to keep them engaged, and ensure good indoor air quality.

Very Unhealthy.q: What should I do if I feel unwell?
Very Unhealthy.a: Rest indoors, drink plenty of water, and seek medical attention if symptoms worsen.

Hazardous.q: What emergency steps should I take?
Hazardous.a: Stay indoors, seal your home, use air purifiers, and follow local emergency instructions.

Hazardous.q: Is it safe to go outside at all?
Hazardous.a: No, avoid going outside unless absolutely necessary and wear a certified mask if you must.

Hazardous.q: How can I seal my home from outdoor air?
Hazardous.a: Use weather stripping, close all windows and doors, and block gaps with towels or tape.

Hazardous.q: What are the signs of severe air pollution illness?
Hazardous.a: Severe symptoms include chest pain, difficulty breathing, confusion, and bluish lips. Seek emergency care immediately.

Hazardous.q: Where can I get real-time emergency updates?
Hazardous.a: Monitor government websites, local news, and official air quality apps for updates.
